subject: Self Care
title: Sleep and Heart Health
description: A 60-second lesson on Sleep and Heart Health.

hook.text: The Monday after daylight saving time sees a 24% spike in heart attacks. One lost hour does that.

buildup.text: During sleep, blood pressure drops 10 to 20 percent. This nightly dip lets blood vessels recover.

discovery.text: Chronic short sleep keeps blood pressure elevated around the clock, accelerating arterial damage.

twist.text: Too much sleep is also risky. Over nine hours regularly is linked to higher cardiovascular events.

climax.text: Seven to eight hours is the cardiovascular sweet spot. Both extremes carry measurable heart risk.

punchline.text: Your heart needs you to sleep â€” not too little, not too much.
